intro: Erodium staphylinum subsp. jacquinianum, commonly known as the slender field erodium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It is a low-growing annual herb with small, pink to purple flowers that bloom during the spring and summer months. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and its fruit is a small, dry capsule that splits open to release seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. This subspecies is part of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive floral structure and ecological adaptability.
